name: Puri Bhaji
history: Puri Bhaji is a classic Indian dish, popular as a breakfast and snack item. It consists of fluffy, deep-fried breads (Puris) served with a spiced potato curry (Bhaji).
description: Puri Bhaji is a delightful combination of crispy and golden deep-fried Indian breads, paired with a flavorful potato-based curry. It's a favorite in many Indian households and is often enjoyed on special occasions.

equipment.name: mixing bowl
equipment.description: Used for preparing the puri dough.

equipment.name: rolling pin
equipment.description: Used for rolling out the puris.

instructions.title: Prepare the Puri Dough
instructions.description: In a mixing bowl, combine whole wheat flour, salt, and enough water to form a stiff dough. Knead well, cover, and set aside for 15-20 minutes.

instructions.title: Make the Bhaji
instructions.description: Boil, peel, and roughly mash the potatoes. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, chopped onions, green chilies, and sautÃ© until onions are translucent. Add turmeric, coriander powder, garam masala, mashed potatoes, and salt. Cook for a few minutes. Add lemon juice and garnish with coriander.

instructions.title: Roll and Fry Puris
instructions.description: Divide the dough into small balls. Roll each ball into a small circle. Heat oil in a deep frying pan and fry the puris until they puff up and turn golden brown.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Serve the hot puris with the flavorful bhaji on the side.

tips: The puri dough should be stiff to ensure that puris puff up when fried.
Fry the puris on medium heat to get them crispy and prevent them from absorbing too much oil.
variations: Add different vegetables like peas or carrots to the bhaji for variation.
Experiment with spices in the bhaji according to taste preferences.

storage.shelfLife: Puri Bhaji is best enjoyed fresh. However, the bhaji can be stored in the refrigerator for up to 2 days.
storage.instructions: Store the bhaji in an airtight container and reheat before serving. Puris should be consumed immediately after frying.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat the bhaji on the stove or in a microwave. Puris are not suitable for reheating as they lose their texture.
presentationTips: Serve on a plate with a side of fresh salad or raita.
